# INSpeakable

**Protocol**

Pronunciation hints for strings used in a spoken interface.

## Declaration

```swift
protocol INSpeakable : NSObjectProtocol
```

## Overview

The [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INSpeakable] protocol is adopted by the [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INSpeakableString] class and used to provide pronunciation hints for strings spoken by Siri. You do not need to adopt this protocol in your own classes. Instead, create instances of the [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INSpeakableString] class and use them when resolving parameters in your intent handlers.

## Getting the Spoken Attributes

- **spokenPhrase**: The phrase identified by Siri.
- **pronunciationHint**: A hint at how the spoken phrase is pronounced.

## Getting the Identifier

- **vocabularyIdentifier**: The identifier associated with the string in your app’s custom vocabulary file.
- **identifier**: The identifier associated with the string in your app’s custom vocabulary file.

## Getting Alternative Matches

- **alternativeSpeakableMatches**: An array of alternative phrases that match the current phrase.

## String

- **INSpeakableString**: A custom phrase to be resolved by an Intents extension.

## Inherits From

- NSObjectProtocol

## Conforming Types

- INObject
- INPerson
- INRestaurantGuest
- INRideDriver
- INSpeakableString
